Sentencas: Electrolytes with high ionic conductivity at lower temperatures are the prerequisite for the success of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC).
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: One promising candidate is doped zirconia.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: In the past its ionic conductivity has mainly been increased by decreasing its thickness.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: However, the influence of the thickness is only linear, whereas the impact of migration barriers is exponential.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: Therefore understanding the oxygen transport in doped zirconia is of fundamental importance.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: In this work we pursue the approach of the strain dependent ionic migration in zirconia.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: We investigate how the migration barriers for oxygen ions respond to a change of the atomic strain.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: We employ the method of Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations to relax the atomic configurations to the ground state.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: In connection with the Nudged Elastic Band (NEB) method we obtain the migration barrier of the oxygen ion jumps in zirconia for a given lattice constant.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: Similar to other publications we observe a decrease in the migration barrier for expansive strain, but in addition we also find a migration barrier decrease for high compressive strains beyond a maximal height of the migration barrier at an intermediate compressive strain.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2

Sentencas: We present a simple analytic model which, by using interactions of the Lennard-Jones type, gives an explanation for this behavior.
Titulo: First-principles study and modeling of strain-dependent ionic migration in ZrO2
